flawed_nl_solution:
Greg and Sarah will split their apples, so 18 apples / 2 = <<18/2=9>>9 apples per child.
Susan has 2 * 9 apples = <<2*9=81>>81 apples.
Mark has 81 apples - 5 apples = <<81-5=76>>76 apples.
Combined the children have 9 apples + 9 apples + 81 apples + 76 apples = <<9+9+81+76=175>>175 apples.
Mom will have 175 apples - 40 apples = <<175-40=135>>135 apples left over.
#### 135

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 18, not 81. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
